ground_truth: Hi runs down the second lane he comes to toward the front of the store, and a pack of dogs appears at the end of the lane, thundering up toward Hi, braying at the top of their doggy lungs, with the lead Doberman holding a paper 7-Eleven cap in his teeth. Hi reverses again and emerges into the back aisle, where a pyramid of cranberry juice explodes at his shoulder with a BANG. Hi looks and sees the Store Manager, a fat man in a white short-sleeved shirt with a lit cigarette in his mouth, standing in the raised platform-cubicle at the front of the store. The Manager cracks open his shotgun, inserts two cartridges with a THOONK THOONK into the smoking chamber, and Hi doubles back again toward the back aisle. The Manager is blowing out groceries on the shelves behind Hi as he coolly levels his police special and takes aim. Still on the dead run, Hi flings the carton of Huggies, which rockets straight at the camera, and futilely raising his gun to avoid impact, the carton catches him square on the chest. The force makes him stumble one fatal step backward into the back aisle, where he is hit broadside and bowled over by a rocketing shopping cart, propelled by an hysterically screaming shopper. Racing on down the back aisle, bellowing, and tracking from in front, beyond her, we see the pack of furiously barking dogs nipping at her heels as Hi emerges through the back door to find Ed skidding around the corner. Hi scrambles in the passenger side, and the car peels out of the lot. With a THWAK, Ed gives him a good hard slap, and Hi's head rolls toward the camera, his eyes fixed on something in the road ahead. Still focused on the road, he is opening his door, even though the car is racing along and absently concedes. In the extreme foreground sits the first carton of Huggies that Hi dropped in the middle of the road as the car approaches. As the car passes the carton, Hi's hand reaches from the passenger door and snags it, pulling the carton in and slamming the door shut. The scene cranes up to the car speeding away as Ed bursts in the front door, holding Nathan Jr. They look up, dumbstruck and mortified from the sofa where they have been watching TV. Ed is unmoved and storms into the bedroom, slamming the door. There is an awkward silence as Gale studies his thumb and Evelle stares at the ceiling, before Evelle finally turns to Hi, his gesture taking in the trailer and the entire domestic situation.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description:
Sure, here's the transformed text with synonyms replacing the non-stop-words:

Hi dashes down the second path he arrives to toward the facade of the shop, and a group of canines emerges at the termination of the path, roaring up toward Hi, baying at the top of their canine lungs, with the lead Doberman grasping a paper 7-Eleven hat in his jaws. Hi retreats again and surfaces into the rear aisle, where a pyramid of cranberry beverage detonates at his shoulder with a BANG. Hi glances and perceives the Store Supervisor, a corpulent gentleman in a white short-sleeved garment with a lit cigarette in his mouth, standing in the elevated platform-cubicle at the facade of the shop. The Supervisor snaps open his shotgun, inserts two shells with a THOONK THOONK into the smoking compartment, and Hi doubles back again toward the rear aisle. The Supervisor is blasting out groceries on the racks behind Hi as he calmly levels his police special and takes aim. Still on the dead sprint, Hi hurls the carton of Huggies, which rockets directly at the camera, and vainly raising his gun to evade impact, the carton strikes him square on the torso. The force causes him to trip one fatal step backward into the rear aisle, where he is struck broadside and toppled by a speeding shopping cart, propelled by a frantically shrieking shopper. Racing on down the rear aisle, bellowing, and tracking from in front, beyond her, we observe the pack of fiercely barking canines biting at her heels as Hi emerges through the rear exit to discover Ed skidding around the bend. Hi scrambles in the passenger side, and the vehicle screeches out of the lot. With a THWAK, Ed delivers him a good firm smack, and Hi's head rolls toward the camera, his eyes fixed on something in the road ahead. Still focused on the road, he is opening his door, even though the vehicle is racing along and absentmindedly concedes. In the extreme foreground sits the first carton of Huggies that Hi dropped in the middle of the road as the vehicle approaches. As the vehicle passes the carton, Hi's hand reaches from the passenger door and snatches it, pulling the carton in and slamming the door shut. The scene cranes up to the vehicle accelerating away as Ed bursts in the front door, holding Nathan Jr. They look up, dumbstruck and mortified from the couch where they have been watching TV. Ed is unmoved and storms into the bedroom, slamming the door. There is an awkward silence as Gale examines his thumb and Evelle gazes at the ceiling, before Evelle finally turns to Hi, his gesture taking in the trailer and the entire domestic situation.

In the passenger side, Hi scrambles, and out of the lot, the car peels. The scene is craned up to the car speeding away as Ed bursts in the front door, holding Nathan Jr. They look up, dumbstruck and mortified from the sofa where TV has been watched by them. Unmoved, Ed storms into the bedroom, slamming the door. There is an awkward silence as his thumb is studied by Gale and the ceiling is stared at by Evelle, before Evelle finally turns to Hi, his gesture taking in the trailer and the entire domestic situation.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Hi runs down the second lane toward the store's front when a pack of dogs charges at him, barking loudly, with a Doberman holding a paper 7-Eleven cap. Hi retreats to the back aisle, where a pyramid of cranberry juice explodes. The Store Manager, a heavyset man in a white shirt with a cigarette, stands in a raised platform, loading his shotgun. Hi darts back to the back aisle as groceries explode on the shelves. Running, he throws a carton of Huggies that hits the Manager before stumbling backward into a shopping cart pushed by a screaming shopper. Hi races down the aisle as barking dogs follow closely. He exits through the back door to find Ed in the car. Hi jumps into the passenger seat, and the car speeds off. Ed slaps him, and Hi focuses on the road, opening his door while reaching for a carton of Huggies dropped earlier. He pulls it in and shuts the door. The car speeds away as Ed enters the house with Nathan Jr. and slams the bedroom door. Gale and Evelle, dumbfounded on the sofa, sit in silence before Evelle gestures at Hi, indicating the entire messy situation.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Hi runs down the second lane toward the front of the store, where a pack of dogs appears, barking loudly, the lead Doberman with a 7-Eleven cap. Hi reverses and enters the back aisle, where a pyramid of cranberry juice explodes near him. The Store Manager, a fat man in a white shirt, stands on the front platform, loading cartridges into his shotgun. Hi doubles back to the aisle as the Manager fires at groceries. Hi flings a carton of Huggies at the camera, hitting the Manager, who stumbles backward into a shopping cart pushed by a screaming shopper. Running on, Hi sees dogs chasing the shopper and exits through the back door where Ed skids around. Hi jumps in the car, and as they speed away, Ed slaps him. Hi reaches out to grab a Huggies carton dropped earlier. As they drive off, Ed enters with Nathan Jr., looking mortified. Unmoved, Ed storms into the bedroom. An awkward silence follows as Gale and Evelle react, Evelle gesturing at Hi and the situation.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Hi is sprinting down the second lane he encounters as he heads toward the front of the store, when suddenly, a pack of dogs makes their appearance at the end of the lane. They thunder toward Hi with all the might they can muster, barking loudly at the top of their doggy lungs. The lead Doberman, in an unusual display, holds a paper 7-Eleven cap firmly in his teeth. In response, Hi reverses his direction once more and finds himself emerging into the back aisle. Here, a neatly stacked pyramid of cranberry juice meets an explosive end right at his shoulder with a resounding BANG. 

Hi turns his gaze and spots the Store Manager, a rather corpulent man clad in a white short-sleeved shirt, nonchalantly with a lit cigarette in his mouth. The Manager stands on a raised platform-cubicle situated at the front of the store. He methodically cracks open his shotgun and smoothly inserts two cartridges with a satisfying THOONK THOONK into the smoking chamber. Hi, realizing the escalating danger, quickly doubles back again toward the back aisle. The Manager is blowing out groceries on the shelves behind Hi with practiced ease, all the while coolly leveling his police special and taking precise aim.

Still in full sprint, Hi hurls the carton of Huggies, which rockets straight toward the camera. Despite futilely raising his gun in an attempt to avoid impact, the carton strikes him square on the chest with a decisive thud. The impact forces him into an unrecoverable stumble, making him take one fateful step backward into the back aisle. Here, he is hit broadside and toppled over by a shopping cart, which is rocketing along and propelled by a hysterically screaming shopper. As the action unfolds, the scene tracks from in front, beyond her, revealing the pack of furiously barking dogs, relentlessly nipping at her heels.

Hi emerges through the back door just in time to see Ed skidding around the corner. Without missing a beat, Hi scrambles into the passenger side, and the car peels out of the lot at high speed. With a sharp THWAK, Ed delivers a good, hard slap to Hi, causing his head to roll toward the camera, his eyes fixed intently on something down the road ahead. Even while keeping his focus on the road, he is opening his door, despite the car racing along, and absently concedes. Sitting in the extreme foreground is the first carton of Huggies that Hi had previously dropped; it lies in the middle of the road as the car rapidly approaches. As the vehicle passes the carton, Hi's hand deftly reaches out from the passenger door, snagging it and pulling the carton inside while promptly slamming the door shut behind it.

The scene then cranes up to reveal the car speeding away. Ed soon bursts through the front door, clutching Nathan Jr. They look up, utterly dumbstruck and mortified, from the sofa where they have been fixed watching TV. Undeterred, Ed storms into the bedroom and slams the door with conviction. An awkward silence envelops the room as Gale intently studies his thumb and Evelle stares blankly at the ceiling. Finally, Evelle turns to Hi, his gesture encompassing both the trailer and the entirety of their domestic situation.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Hi is energetically sprinting down the second lane he comes across as he makes his way toward the front end of the bustling store. Suddenly, as if out of nowhere, a pack of energetic dogs appears at the far end of the lane. They come thundering down toward Hi with all the energy they can summon, barking loudly and incessantly at the top of their doggy lungs. Leading the charge, a Doberman unexpectedly holds a paper 7-Eleven cap firmly clasped between its teeth. Reacting quickly, Hi changes his direction once more and finds himself emerging into the back aisle. Here, he is greeted by the sight of a neatly stacked pyramid of cranberry juice, which meets an explosive and dramatic end right at his shoulder with an ear-splitting BANG.

Hi's attention is immediately drawn to the Store Manager, a rather corpulent and hefty man who stands clad in a white short-sleeved shirt, nonchalantly balancing a lit cigarette in his mouth. The Manager is perched on a raised platform-cubicle located at the very front of the store. With deliberate precision, he cracks open his shotgun and smoothly inserts two cartridges with a deeply satisfying THOONK THOONK into the smoking chamber. Realizing the escalating and immediate danger, Hi quickly doubles back yet again toward the back aisle. The Manager, unfazed, is blowing out groceries on the shelves behind Hi with remarkable, practiced ease and continues to coolly level his police special, taking precise, calculated aim.

Still propelled by urgency, Hi remains in full sprint and hurls a carton of Huggies, which rockets straight toward the camera's lens. Despite his futile effort to raise his gun in an attempt to evade the incoming impact, the carton strikes him squarely on the chest with a decisive thud. This impact forces him into an irrecoverable stumble, making him take one unfortunate step backward into the back aisle. It is here that he is hit broadside and toppled over by a speeding shopping cart, which is propelled forward by a hysterically screaming shopper. As this chaotic action unfolds, the scene tracks from in front, revealing beyond her, the pack of furiously barking dogs that continue to relentlessly nip at her heels.

Hi bursts through the back door just in time to witness Ed skidding dramatically around the corner. Without missing a beat in the unfolding chaos, Hi scrambles into the passenger side of the vehicle, and they peel out of the parking lot at incredibly high speed. With a sharp and resounding THWAK, Ed delivers a good, hard slap to Hi, causing his head to loll toward the camera, his eyes fixed intently on something down the road ahead. Even while keeping his gaze firmly and intensely focused on the road, he opens his door, despite the car racing along, and absently concedes. The first carton of Huggies that Hi had previously dropped sits in the extreme foreground; it lies right in the middle of the road as the car rapidly approaches. As the vehicle speeds past the carton, Hi's hand deftly reaches out from the passenger door, skillfully snagging it and pulling the carton inside before promptly slamming the door shut behind it.

The scene then cranes up to reveal the car as it speeds away into the distance. Soon, Ed bursts through the front door, clutching Nathan Jr. They both look up, completely dumbstruck and mortified, from the sofa where they have been glued, watching TV. Unfazed and determined, Ed storms into the bedroom and slams the door shut with unyielding conviction. An awkward, lingering silence envelops the room as Gale intently studies his thumb with great focus and Evelle stares blankly at the ceiling above. Finally, Evelle turns to Hi, his gesture encompassing both the trailer and the entirety of their domestic situation, pondering the circumstances they find themselves in.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Hi races down the narrow second lane he encounters on his way to the front of the store, his breath comes in quick pants, and his feet pound against the floor, echoing in the confined space. Suddenly, a pack of dogs materializes at the end of the lane, their paws thundering up toward Hi as they bark loudly, each howl resonating with urgency. The lead Doberman charges ahead, gripping a paper 7-Eleven cap firmly in its teeth as it leads the pack. Realizing the threat, Hi pivots abruptly, reversing his direction and bursting into the back aisle. Behind him, a carefully stacked pyramid of cranberry juice shatters with a deafening BANG, sending shards of glass and a shower of juice cascading around his shoulder. Hi quickly scans the area and spots the Store Managerâ€”a heavyset man clad in a white short-sleeved shirt with a cigarette precariously dangling from his lipsâ€”stationed in a raised platform-cubicle at the store's front. With practiced efficiency, the Manager cracks open his shotgun, and Hi watches as he slips two cartridges into the smoking chamber with reverberating THOONK THOONK sounds. Sensing immediate danger, Hi urgently doubles back toward the back aisle, where the Manager is methodically blowing apart groceries on the shelves directly behind him, coolly zeroing in his aim from the police special. Desperately sprinting, Hi flings a carton of Huggies with all his might, and it zooms straight at the camera. The abrupt trajectory forces the Manager to instinctively raise his gun in a futile attempt to prevent impact, and the carton crashes squarely into his chest, the force of which causes him to stagger backward. This misstep sends him careening into the back aisle, where he is unexpectedly struck broadside by a shopping cart. The cart, seemingly hurtling by its own volition, is actually propelled by a shopper who is screaming hysterically. Meanwhile, racing further down the back aisle, the pack of dogs continues their relentless pursuit, barking furiously as they nip at the frantic shopper's heels. Just as Hi bursts through the back door, he catches sight of Ed skidding around the corner in a car. Hi scrambles into the passenger side, feeling the vehicle's momentum as it peels out of the lot. A sharp THWAK rings out as Ed delivers a resounding slap to Hi, causing his head to jolt toward the camera, eyes momentarily fixed on an object in the road. Maintaining focus on the road ahead, Hi absently opens his door as the car speeds along. His attention shifts to the carton of Huggiesâ€”the very one he initially droppedâ€”which now sits conspicuously in the middle of the road. As the car nears the carton, Hi's hand swiftly extends from the passenger door, snags it with precision, and pulls it inside, slamming the door shut immediately after. While the scene shifts, the camera cranes up to reveal the car speeding away, and inside, Ed bursts through the front door with Nathan Jr. in tow. She enters to find Gale and Evelle, who appear dumbstruck and mortified as they watch TV in silence. Despite their reaction, Ed remains unmoved, storming into the bedroom with determination and forcefully slamming the door shut behind her. An awkward silence ensues, broken only by Gale's absent-minded examination of his thumb and Evelle's blank stare at the ceiling. Finally breaking the tension, Evelle turns to Hi, his gesture sweeping across the trailer, encapsulating the entire chaotic domestic situation they have become embroiled in.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Hi races down the second lane toward the store's front when a pack of barking dogs, led by a Doberman with a 7-Eleven cap in its teeth, charges toward him. He quickly changes direction, reaching the back aisle, where a pyramid of cranberry juice bursts beside him. He notices the Store Managerâ€”a heavyset man in a white shirt, smoking and loading a shotgunâ€”on a platform at the store's front. As the Manager fires and bullets hit shelves behind him, Hi hurls a carton of Huggies, which strikes the Manager, causing him to stagger into the back aisle. This collision sends Hi sprawling, hit by a crazed shopper's speeding cart. Racing down the back aisle with barking dogs close behind, Hi exits through the store's back door, finding Ed skidding around the corner. He scrambles into the passenger seat, and the car speeds away. Ed slaps him, and Hi, eyes on the road, opens his door as the car approaches the dropped carton of Huggies. He reaches out, grabs the carton, and shuts the door. As the car speeds off, Ed holds Nathan Jr., and inside the house, stunned TV watchers glance up. Unmoved, Ed storms into the bedroom, while Gale and Evelle sit awkwardly, with Evelle eventually gesturing toward Hi, acknowledging the chaotic domestic situation.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Hi, sprinting down the second lane designed for express checkouts, comes to a halt near the front of the store, a chain that famously sells convenience items 24/7. A pack of dogs appears at the end of the lane, reminiscent of guard dogs but unleashed, thundering toward Hi with the lead Doberman carrying a paper 7-Eleven cap, a novelty item from the store, in his teeth. Hi reverses direction and emerges into the back aisle, where a pyramid of cranberry juice bottles, perhaps part of a promotional display, explodes at his shoulder with a BANG. Hi looks and sees the Store Manager, a burly man in a standard-issue white short-sleeved uniform, with a lit cigarette dangling from his mouth, standing in the raised platform-cubicle typical of small retail operations at the front. The Manager cracks open his shotgun, a move echoing law enforcement practices, and inserts two cartridges with a THOONK THOONK into the smoking chamber. Hi doubles back again toward the back aisle, evading as the Manager, drawing on his police training, fires and blows out groceries on the shelves behind Hi. Still on the dead run, Hi flings the carton of Huggies, a brand of diapers known for their snug fit, which rockets straight at the camera. The Manager futilely raises his gun to avoid impact, and the carton catches him square on the chest. The force propels him to stumble one fatal step backward into the back aisle, where he is hit broadside and bowled over by a rocketing shopping cart, driven by an hysterically screaming shopper panicking in the commotion. Racing on down the back aisle, bellowing with urgency, and tracking from in front of her, the pack of fiercely barking dogs nips at her heels as Hi emerges through the back door, strategically placed for delivery and emergency exits, to find Ed skidding around the corner in a getaway car. Hi scrambles into the passenger side, and the car peels out of the lot, tires screeching on the asphalt. With a THWAK, Ed gives him a good hard slap, and Hi's head rolls toward the camera, his eyes fixed on a distant point in the road ahead. Still focused on the road, he opens his door, a risky maneuver since the car is racing along, and absently concedes to a plan. In the extreme foreground sits the first carton of Huggies that Hi dropped in the middle of the road, a potential accident hazard, as the car approaches. As the car passes the carton, Hi's hand reaches from the passenger door and snags it, pulling the carton in and slamming the door shut. The scene cranes up to the car speeding away, symbolizing a narrow escape, as Ed bursts in the front door of their trailer home, holding Nathan Jr., a toddler with an innocent face. They look up, dumbstruck and mortified from the sofa where they have been watching TV, a pastime that often serves as a distraction from real life. Ed is unmoved and storms into the bedroom, slamming the door in frustration. There is an awkward silence as Gale, a man with rough, weathered hands, studies his thumb and Evelle, with a perpetual look of confusion, stares at the ceiling, before Evelle finally turns to Hi, his gesture taking in the cluttered trailer and the entire chaotic domestic situation.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Hi runs down the second lane he comes to toward the front of the store and a pack of dogs appears at the end of the lane thundering up toward Hi braying at the top of their doggy lungs with the lead Doberman holding a paper 7Eleven cap in his teeth. Hi reverses again and emerges into the back aisle where a pyramid of cranberry juice explodes at his shoulder with a BANG. Hi looks and sees the Store Manager a fat man in a white shortsleeved shirt with a lit cigarette in his mouth standing in the raised platformcubicle at the front of the store. The Manager cracks open his shotgun inserts two cartridges with a THOONK THOONK into the smoking chamber and Hi doubles back again toward the back aisle. The Manager is blowing out groceries on the shelves behind Hi as he coolly levels his police special and takes aim. As the car passes the carton Hi's hand reaches from the passenger door and snags it pulling the carton in and slamming the door shut. The scene cranes up to the car speeding away as Ed bursts in the front door holding Nathan Jr. They look up dumbstruck and mortified from the sofa where they have been watching TV. Ed is unmoved and storms into the bedroom slamming the door. There is an awkward silence as Gale studies his thumb and Evelle stares at the ceiling before Evelle finally turns to Hi his gesture taking in the trailer and the entire domestic situation.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)

Hi reverses again and emerges into the back aisle where a pyramid of cranberry juice explodes at his shoulder with a BANG. Ed is unmoved and storms into the bedroom slamming the door. There is an awkward silence as Gale studies his thumb and Evelle stares at the ceiling before Evelle finally turns to Hi his gesture taking in the trailer and the entire domestic situation.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Jill dances up the fourth corridor she approaches away from the back of the workshop, and a group of cats materializes at the start of the corridor, galloping down toward Jill, howling at the top of their feline voices, with the front Persian clutching a plastic Burger King crown in its claws. Jill pivots once more and bursts into the front passageway, where a tower of pineapple soda implodes at her elbow with a CLASH. Jill glances and notices the Workshop Foreman, a lean woman in a blue long-sleeved dress with an unlit matchstick in her hand, standing in the sunken compartment-booth at the back of the workshop. The Foreman uncaps her rifle, loads three darts with a CLACK CLACK into the empty barrel, and Jill pivots forward once again toward the front passageway. The Foreman is knocking over hardware on the racks in front of Jill as she calmly raises her laser pointer and gets ready. Still on the rapid move, Jill hurls the packet of Pampers, which zooms directly at the audience, and uselessly hoisting her pointer to deflect collision, the packet strikes her directly on the forehead. The impact causes her to lurch one crucial step onward into the front passageway, where she is struck sideways and toppled by a rushing wheelbarrow, driven by a deliriously laughing customer. Darting on down the front passageway, hollering, and filming from behind, further beyond him, we observe the group of wildly meowing cats nipping at his ankles as Jill bursts through the front entrance to find Ted skidding around the bend. Jill clambers into the driver side, and the van skids out of the garage. With a WHACK, Ted gives her a gentle tap, and Jill's head swivels toward the audience, her eyes locked on something in the lane ahead. Still concentrated on the lane, she is shutting her hatch, even though the van is cruising swiftly and silently confirms. In the near background sits the first packet of Pampers that Jill abandoned in the middle of the lane as the van draws near. As the van crosses the packet, Jill's arm extends from the driver hatch and hooks it, hauling the packet in and snapping the hatch shut. The camera pans up to the van racing off as Ted storms in the back entrance, clutching Nathan Jr. They glance down, shocked and humiliated from the armchair where they have been viewing cartoons. Ted is still unfazed and charges into the kitchen, slamming the hatch. There is a tense silence as Eve examines her palm and George gazes at the floor, before George eventually turns to Jill, his motion encompassing the house and the complete familial scenario.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Hi races down a store aisle, pursued by a pack of barking dogs. As he reverses direction to evade them, a pyramid of cranberry juice erupts. The Store Manager, a portly man with a shotgun, stands on a platform, shooting at Hi. Hi hurls a carton of Huggies at the manager, causing him to stumble backward. A shopping cart crashes into Hi, driven by a screaming shopper, and he escapes through the back door. Ed pulls up in a car, and Hi jumps in. While the car speeds away, Hi grabs the Huggies carton he had dropped earlier. The scene shifts to Ed bursting into the house holding Nathan Jr., leaving everyone stunned. Ed storms into the bedroom, slamming the door. An awkward silence falls as Gale and Evelle sit on the sofa, contemplating their situation.
